messages.subject: Life Is Good! [was: Evacuating-or not!]
messages.msgSnippet: We woke up this morning to the best news ever!  The hurrican pretty much missed Houston.  We doing just fine, we still have power in the city and we re headed
messages.messageBody:
We woke up this morning to the best news ever! The hurrican pretty much missed Houston. We doing just fine, we still have power in the city and we're headed home. Thanks for all the help and support! Little Debbies for breakfast for everyone!

Holly

Unschooler <unschooler@...> wrote:
I thank all of you so much! All of your thoughts, prayers, pyschic energies, chants and love seem to be working. It looks better and better everytime I watch the news!

Holly

Cally Brown wrote:
> On a funny/sad note- my 15 yo dd (and the only one still hsing, btw)
> said that if she dies to bury her in a shirt that says "I survived
> Hurricane Bob, I survived Tropical Storm Allison, I survived Hurrican
> Rita" with the last line crossed out. She has a sick sense of humor
> but it's hard to see your kids so scared that they're thinking
> (actually, knowing after Katrina) that they may not make it. I'm
> *sure* we will but there is always that thought in the back of your mind.

What can I say Holly, other than that I have been thinking of you
constantly the last few days, and sending you all love and hugs from the
bottom of the world.

(((((((hugs)))))))
Cally
in New Zealand

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Evacuating-or not!
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks to everyone for the support, infomation and offers of help!  I ll be sure to post when it s all over to let everyone know how we fared.  Actually, the
messages.messageBody:
Thanks to everyone for the support, infomation and offers of help! I'll be sure to post when it's all over to let everyone know how we fared. Actually, the girls made sure we have plenty of batteries for the digital camera and that the camcorder was fully charged. They're looking forward to chronicling the storm.

On a funny/sad note- my 15 yo dd (and the only one still hsing, btw) said that if she dies to bury her in a shirt that says "I survived Hurricane Bob, I survived Tropical Storm Allison, I survived Hurrican Rita" with the last line crossed out. She has a sick sense of humor but it's hard to see your kids so scared that they're thinking (actually, knowing after Katrina) that they may not make it. I'm *sure* we will but there is always that thought in the back of your mind.

Holly

Ren Allen <starsuncloud@...> wrote:
I'll be thinking of you Holly. It sounds like you're in a safe place,
somewhere you can get higher up if the water rises right? That's the
main thing. It's not the wind that kills people, it's the water....for
those of you that haven't had to deal with hurricanes. ugh.

The part that is worrisome, is after the hurricane. There won't be
resources available, I hope you're really well stocked. It's amazing
how hard it is just to get basic necessities...and you stand in very
long lines for those things.

I'll be thinking about all of you in Rita's path. MY path is to head
FAR away from hurricanes very shortly. I'm just hoping none of them
come this way to stop us from closing on our house. Stay safe Holly!

Ren

messages.subject: Evacuating-or not!
messages.msgSnippet: I ll be thinking of you Holly. It sounds like you re in a safe place, somewhere you can get higher up if the water rises right? That s the main thing. It s not
messages.messageBody:
I'll be thinking of you Holly. It sounds like you're in a safe place,
somewhere you can get higher up if the water rises right? That's the
main thing. It's not the wind that kills people, it's the water....for
those of you that haven't had to deal with hurricanes. ugh.

The part that is worrisome, is after the hurricane. There won't be
resources available, I hope you're really well stocked. It's amazing
how hard it is just to get basic necessities...and you stand in very
long lines for those things.

I'll be thinking about all of you in Rita's path. MY path is to head
FAR away from hurricanes very shortly. I'm just hoping none of them
come this way to stop us from closing on our house. Stay safe Holly!

Ren
